summary: Professional, responsive, government-style web dashboard for a Vehicle AI Safety Black Box system, built with pure HTML/CSS/JS (no frameworks), consuming an existing Node.js backend (GET /violations) to show live-updating violations, proof images from /uploads, score-based alerts, challan preview UI, and notification simulations across multiple static pages (index/vehicle/challan).
architectural_notes: UI constraints: official/government style (white background, dark blue headers), no animations/fancy effects
Must handle empty API responses with clear empty states
Backend API endpoint: GET /violations (Node.js backend; use fetch('/violations'))
Images served from /uploads and accessible at http://localhost:3000/uploads/<filename>
Required pages: index.html (dashboard), vehicle.html (vehicle details), challan.html (challan preview)

existing_features.title: Create a professional, government/official-style responsive dashboard layout (mobile + desktop) with a white background and dark-blue headers, and no animations or fancy visual effects.
Implement frontend routing/navigation with these pages: Home/Dashboard, Live Violations, and Challan Management, presented as an official portal (e.g., top header + simple navigation).
Build the Home/Dashboard page with the title “Smart Vehicle Black Box System – Live Monitoring” and a short description about monitoring vehicle safety, violations, and challans.

Implement the Live Violations page that fetches real data from https://vehicle-blackbox-system.onrender.com/api/violations using JavaScript fetch(), and displays results in a table with columns: Vehicle Number, Violation Type, Severity, Timestamp.
Add auto-refresh on the Live Violations page to re-fetch /api/violations every few seconds and update the table accordingly.

Implement the Challan Management page that fetches real data from https://vehicle-blackbox-system.onrender.com/api/challans using JavaScript fetch(), and displays: Vehicle Number, Violations List, Fine Amount, and Status (Warning / Challan Issued).

Add a Violation Evidence section on the Challan Management page (or within each challan/record) that displays images if image URLs are present in the API response, labeled clearly as “Driver Camera” and “Road Camera”.
Handle empty data states for violations and challans (e.g., show “No violations recorded yet” when /api/violations returns empty), and avoid showing blank screens.
Implement the app in demo mode with no authentication (no Internet Identity login requirement) and ensure the primary flows (view violations, view challans, view evidence) work without signing in.

Update the frontend API integration to fetch violations from the existing Node.js backend using fetch('/violations') (relative URL) and handle the response schema: [{ vehicleNo, ownerName, mobile, violationType, timestamp, score, imageUrl }].

Modify the Live Violations view to match the requested dashboard table: live-updating (auto-refresh every 3 seconds) violations table with columns Time, Vehicle No, Violation Type, Score, Proof Image, and Status.

Implement proof image rendering for violations using the Node.js uploads convention. If the API provides a filename, construct the URL as http://localhost:3000/uploads/<filename>; if the API provides a full URL/path, display it as-is.
Add a “Latest Violation” section (violation cards) that always shows the newest violation at the top with a large proof image and key details (vehicle number, violation type, time, score).

Implement the score system and alert banner: compute the total score from the currently loaded violations; when total score is greater than or equal to 5, show a red alert banner with the exact text: “MULTIPLE VIOLATIONS — DATA SENT TO RTO”.

Add challan generation UI as a modal popup “Challan Preview” that can be opened from a violation (or the latest violation card) and displays: vehicle number, owner name, violation list, total fine, timestamp, and proof image; include a “Download PDF” button that is frontend-simulated (no real PDF generation required).

Implement notification simulation popups based on incoming violation updates: when a new violation is detected compared to the previously loaded dataset, show a popup with the exact text “Alert sent to owner”; if multiple violations condition is met (total score ≥ 5), show a popup with the exact text “Report sent to 112”.

Add React Router pages to match the requested information architecture: a Vehicle Details page (equivalent to vehicle.html) and a Challan Preview page (equivalent to challan.html), and update the navigation to include these pages where appropriate.

new_feature_requests.summary: Dashboard (index.html): live-updating violations table (auto-refresh every 3s) with columns Time, Vehicle No, Violation Type, Score, Proof Image, Status
Violation Cards: show latest violation at top with large proof image
Score system + alert banner: when total score ≥ 5 show red banner “MULTIPLE VIOLATIONS — DATA SENT TO RTO”
Challan Generation UI: modal challan preview (vehicle no, owner name, violation list, total fine, timestamp, proof image) with simulated Download PDF button
Notification simulation: on violation show popup “Alert sent to owner”; if multiple violations show popup “Report sent to 112”
Pure HTML/CSS/JS (no React/frameworks); fetch data via fetch('/violations'); mobile responsive; include pages: index.html (dashboard), vehicle.html (vehicle details), challan.html (challan preview)

projectName: Smart Vehicle Black Box & Violation Management System
